tasks.task: Understand how vaccines work and the role of animals in vaccine research.
subtasks: Explain that vaccines help the immune system recognize and fight viruses.
Describe how phagocytes and B cells contribute to the immune response.
Illustrate the process of antibodies attaching to viral protein spikes.
Discuss the concept of immunity developed from past exposures.
Explain the role of vaccines in teaching the immune system without actual infection.
Describe the preparation of vaccines, including removing damaging parts of the virus.
Highlight the importance of animal testing in vaccine safety and efficacy.
Mention specific animals used in vaccine research (ferrets, laboratory mice, chickens).
Emphasize the global significance of animal studies in developing vaccines.
